name: Federation for European Storytelling
goal:
The Federation of European Storytelling (FEST) is a European network of organisations, networks and
associations active in the field of oral storytelling. Its members represent national, regional or local
organisations like professional storytelling associations, festival organisers, storytelling training centres,
local authorities, academies, colleges, universities, cultural centres or libraries all with a special interest
in storytelling. FEST has 76 members in 25 different countries. The network aims to empower the world
of storytelling in Europe through sharing, learning and relationship building. FEST wants to enhance the
visibility and the recognition of Storytelling as a performing art and focuses on professional
development of the oral storyteller as a performing artist and as a professional provider of storytelling
techniques in other (cultural) sectors. FEST wants to raise the European dimension of Storytelling
events and transnational cooperation in the sector as well as build a 'culture for storytelling' (audience
development).
interests: Culture, Culture and media, Education and training, Youth
euInitiatives:
FEST received a grant within the Creative Europe program for its Network project FESTNET. Special interest in EU cultural policy: European Agenda for Culture, EU Workplan for Culture. Next to the Creative Europe programme for culture, FEST follows developments in programmes Horizon2020 and Erasmus+.
We follow policies and initiatives on mobility (I-portunus), cultural diplomacy, cultural heritage, social issues, education and competences.
